subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. This species presents variation in body color, which can be violet, blue or green on the head, pronotum and elytra; and red, violet and blue on the abdomen, and the ventral surface is always lighter. The apical antennomere in males is longer than in females; the external basal mandibular channel is poorly developed in some specimens ( 30 %).
Comparative notes. The species is similar to P. i g n e u s in the color pattern of the abdomen; the main differences are noted in the Comparative notes of that species.
